column4: hey, i want to use ndiswrapper and would like to know where i find the .inf file?
you find it with the installer for the Windows driver
just take the installer and open it with a program called cabextract
i dont have a cd, i have to download it...but how do i know which chipset i have?
do you see an option to enable with right click?
what's the name of the driver as shown in the ndiswrapper command line?
ok, what do you see in network settings?
i think there is a lannetwork and something else, but no wireless
ok.. I need you to go into the console and type sudo ndiswrapper -l and post me the output on http://paste.ubuntu.com
oh... that makes a big difference
did you download windows x64 drivers?
so can you give me the output to "sudo ndiswrapper -l" in paste.ubuntu.com or what?
can you at least tell me what the output looks like here then?
or are you not even using the Ubuntu box right now?
